audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker saying "Avatar." A female voice, possibly an AI persona, explains that physical presence is expensive and that being digital allows her to be in multiple places supporting business functions. A male speaker interjects, asking who they are talking to. Another male voice states that "Cloudminds" is a company.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker describing a history of using "cloud AI conversation," explaining it's currently utilized with "Pepper." He clarifies that the conversation is limited to where "there's a Pepper," referring to "a robot from Softbank Robotics". The background includes ambient noise suggesting a busy environment.

The clip opens with speech from a man, enthusiastic, talking about working on "Pepper" and developing a product allowing conversations anywhere with a "digital avatar." He explains the avatar can appear on TVs, phones, websites, or in retail kiosks. A woman then asks if the avatar can speak like Google Voice. This exchange takes place in a public setting, evidenced by the presence of background speech.

The audio clip features one male speaker describing their AI platform on the back end. They discuss its natural language processing and speech capabilities, as well as its ability to score conversations and assess the confidence level of answers. They emphasize the unique aspect of having a "human in the loop" who can intervene, located somewhere in the cloud, which could be anywhere in the world. Throughout the explanation, the speaker sounds professional and enthusiastic. The audio also includes general background sounds, suggesting a bustling environment, with many conversations taking place.

The audio clip features a conversation about the limitations of AI, specifically that even the best AI can only answer about 80% of the questions. A male speaker explains that a human-in-the-loop system fills this gap, being part of the learning process for the AI, and learning from interactions with customers. The background contains a busy atmosphere with noticeable crowd noise.

The clip opens with a male speaker remarking on the 3D and Hydrogen phone, noting the display looks "amazing." He proceeds to greet someone, asking "What's your name?" and "Who are you?" A female voice then responds, identifying herself as Claudia, a virtual avatar created by Cloudminds Technology and powered by Cloud AI. A different male voice follows, explaining how building an avatar involves crafting muscle structure to formulate words, tying together facial expressions and emoting to create emotional ties to a brand. He suggests that an avatar can establish a face for a brand and create emotional connections, especially for retail customers on websites. Throughout, the audio is overlaid with noisy background sounds.

The clip starts with a male speaker emphasizing the accessibility of a service, stating "You can live on a phone, you can live in a kiosk". He suggests it allows brands to talk to customers at any point in their "buying journey" and be the "face of your customer". The soundscape is then dominated by background noise, creating the impression of a bustling environment.

The clip starts with a male speaker talking about a "brand" and how they can create a "complete custom avatar" for a company. The speaker continues to explain they can create someone's own spokesperson. Another speaker, presumably female, notes that the app is running on a Snapdragon phone. The male speaker confirms it's running on a phone, but can be run on many different devices, describing it as "an Android app" and noting that because it's in the cloud, it can run on many different things. Throughout the speech, there is the consistent presence of background noise, adding an ambient layer to the conversation.

The clip starts with a conversation about 3D graphics and their function in a device, noting that it is being developed with the intention of becoming a hologram. Further speech discusses partnership through an edge device, embedding robots, and the possibility of a 5G device. Ambient background noise is heard throughout the clip, characterized by general crowd sounds suggesting an event or public gathering.

The audio clip consists of speech, where one man's enthusiastic voice is speaking about 5G, emphasizing low latency for a new robot launching in February. He mentions remote control of the robot's hands and gestures, identifies the company as CloudMinds, which does quad robotics. He specifies that they are based in Santa Clara but have offices in China and Japan. He then notes they've been doing conversational AI with Pepper and other robots, wanting to bridge the gap between e-commerce and brick and mortar via an avatar. The background is filled with sounds indicating a busy environment, with the noise of people talking and ambient sounds creating a general hustle and bustle atmosphere.

The clip begins with a male speaker describing a shopping experience with Claudia, who facially recognizes him and personalizes the shopping experience. This speaker sounds enthusiastic and conversational. He suggests Claudia can locate items for him or notify someone to bring them to the dressing room. A second male speaker excitedly suggests how a shopping experience could feature Claudia on many TVs throughout the store or talk to a customer on their phone. He mentions how Claudia can be designed to pick up his voice anywhere in the store. The first speaker agrees. He then talks about integrating Claudia into a brand's app. The background has the sounds of a bustling environment with indistinct chatter.

The audio features speech, with a male speaker discussing engaging with customers through avatars and the potential for more honest interactions. He mentions how "conversations are in the back end" and the significance of a "cloud brain." His tone is conversational and informative. A second speaker, possibly female, asks about the strategy for successful implementation, mentioning "being everywhere" and using a "free app." The male speaker responds, focusing on customization of the avatar and cloud integration. Throughout the speech, there is noticeable background noise suggesting a busy environment.

The clip begins with two male speakers discussing the use of avatars to answer questions about a product, even when the customer is at the beach. One of them expresses the need to be a "world leader" in terms of interactions, and references Google having many interactions every day. The other speaker agrees, noting the importance of those interactions for the AI's learning process. A suggestion is made about integrating the avatar with Google Assistant, perhaps with a custom voice. The conversation continues with the possibility of integration with Alexa as well, with the speaker emphasizing the importance of the integration being on the back end. In the background, there is consistent, moderate ambient noise, with voices that suggest the clip was recorded at a public gathering.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker explaining that enterprise customers already have a call center and Q\&A built, to which they simply load their Q\&A into the avatar. He describes it as "this knowledge set, this knowledge base" for the avatar to draw from in order to answer questions. Another female speaker then asks if the system can record her face and voice, to have her speak through the avatar. The male speaker responds that it's possible "at some point, not too far" and explains that they can do a 3D scan of the face and voice with certain parameters. He also clarifies that the avatars are built within the Unity platform and are integrated with the ArCloud AI conversational platform. He closes by mentioning that it's "not an easy process yet" but "the knowledge curve is getting up there fast." Throughout the clip, ambient background noise is audible, suggesting that the setting is a crowded, possibly conference or trade show, environment.
